<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Emissary of Peace](/Feats.aspx?ID=3580) <actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
<trait label="Skill" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=144" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 74</row>

**Archetype** [Knight Vigilant](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=27)

**Prerequisites**
[Knight Vigilant](/Feats.aspx?ID=1092)

</column>

---

Even when bloodshed is inevitable, you would rather see your foes surrender. You attempt a Diplomacy check to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=50) against a single foe whose Hit Points are at less than half of their maximum value, followed by an immediate [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=51) to convince that creature to cease fighting. You take a –5 penalty to your Diplomacy check. The GM sets the DC of the Request based on the circumstances; it's generally at least a very hard DC for the creature's level. Some creatures might simply refuse, and those who agree to parley might find your arguments lacking and start fighting again.
name: Emissary of Peace
